comments:
To reproduce:
1) Create a "working" JSF Project as normal.  
2) Create an incomplete JSF Library and add a reference to the project.  I created a library with only jenia4faces_1.2.1.jar.   I would imagine any library with missing required refs would behave similarily
3) Create a JSP page and add h:inputText
4) In source view add converter attribute and request content assist.

You should get exception of:
org.eclipse.emf.common.util.WrappedException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Program Files\EclipseM6\jenia-popup-config.xml (The system cannot find the file specified)

Unclear if EMF2SAXRenderer handles entities in the top-level faces-config.xml file incorrectly or if the format of file chosen by Jenia is simply incorrect. Anyway, it cannot be loaded by EMF2SAXRenderer and so we log an error once per session but content assist continues to function. This is the best we can do. The stacktrace as shown in this bug is part of the error logged (as expected).

traces.message: C:\Program Files\EclipseM6\jenia-popup-config.xml (The system cannot find the file specified)

causedBy.message: C:\Program Files\EclipseM6\jenia-popup-config.xml (The system cannot find the file specified)
